page.title: 20AERIAL VIEW
page.content: In one of our courses at school it was arranged that we could go up in a small aeroplane and survey the countryside around Gatesgill, taking photographs and making a video recording of what we saw. Flying over the area was a lovely experience: the fields below were like a patchwork of greens and browns. Leading across the fields were faint tracks made by the constant tread of a busy farming community. Sparsely spread across this land are smallholdings with their dark slate roofs, where people may farm as little as ten acres or as much as a thousand acres. At this time of year (June) the fields are lined with rows of cut grass wilting ready to make silage. In other fields winter barley turns from flush green to ripening golden brown.
